items.quote:
For Tears of the Kingdom, my experience playing through the game has been bad.  I have nothing against TotK using the same map as BotW but with 2 added landscape to explore, the sky and depths.  Exploring the world of TotK seems rewarding at first, but it starts getting old too fast and the only reward is just seeing the sites.  You still have to find hundreds of Korok seeds to expand your weapon, bows, and shields inventories to functional levels.  There are physical dungeons, but they don't hold the charm as the traditional Zelda games achieved.

The most important factors of any game is the content and how you play in it.  The content is more quantity than quality.  The gameplay feels good if you have plenty of resources to burn through.  Finding great weapons is a bit more difficult in TotK than BotW due to new mechanics from the Zonai technology.  To incentivize using the fusion mechanic, weapons have lower durability than they had in BotW.  As long as you have decent fusion material, you can make "decent" weapons, but for me, that fusion material pool is used for too much, and this led to terrible experiences with combat.  If I want a better time dealing with tough encounters, it involved spending hours in the depths farming for bombs and materials.

Overall, the game play is more punishing than Dark Souls type games.  If this is the future of Zelda games, the series is doomed.

items.quote:
Points positifs :
- Le jeu est fourni, il est difficile de s'ennuyer.
- L'histoire est prenante, voire touchante. Pour une fois, les quatres élus sont vivant. Les gens nous connaissent (et pas que les vieux zoras).
- Les nombreux pouvoirs permettent de libérer sa créativité de toutes les manières, et les nombreuses solutions aux énigmes nous font nous sentir plus malins que le jeu.
- Un tas de nouveaux plats, de nouvelles tenues, de nouveaux ingrédients, de nouvelles fonctionnalités.
- Une véritable amélioration, des détails qui font toute la différence.
- La plupart de PNJ sont retravaillés. Alors qu'on avait jusque là que trois âges (enfant, adulte, personne âgée), un quatrième a fait son apparition (adolescent).

Points négatifs :
- Un jeu beaucoup trop bazar. On est submergés par des quêtes, des grottes, des puits, des korogus et des monstres.
- Un total oubli du jeu précédent. Toute la technologie archéonique a disparu, les château d'Hyrule a perdu toute sa saveur. Pas de nouveaux secrets sur les vestiges anciens.
- La nouvelle technologie magique n'est pas belle. Du vert brillant, de la "glue", une batterie...? Et surtout, la technologie magique ne semble pas exister dans l'histoire. Dans Botw, l'histoire était centrée sur les gardiens, les sheikas, les créatures divines. Là, hormis Ganondorf et sa magie, on n'entend jamais les personnages s'en sortir grâce à la technologie, qui est pourtant le centre du jeu.
- Pas d'ajouts. Pas de nouveaux peuples, de nouveaux villages, alors que la taille de la map a triplé ! À croire que les développeurs n'ont créé ces nouveaux lieux que pour "stocker" du matériel...

reviewedProduct.title: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

family.name: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

game.name: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

items.quote: Este juego, puesto simplemente, es el mejor juego que jugué en mi vida. Las habilidades que se presentan podrían ser, cada una, revolucionarias e increíbles por sí solas. Pero no, acá están las 4 juntas. Ya a nivel mecánico, este juego es una locura nunca antes vista. La forma en la que se puede manipular todo el entorno, y a su vez usar las diversas habilidades a la ves para hacer lo que te dé la gana es una genialidad. Por ejemplo (muy simple), quiero llegar a un lugar alto, entonces agarro una tabla de madera, la alzo, luego la dejo caer y retrocedo el tiempo para infiltrarme. Por más tonto que parezca, esto es una completa locura solo a nivel jugable si no que en programación. Y para agregar más, se agregaron las islas en el cielo, un subsuelo igual de grande que el mapa original, y una red cientos de cuevas y cientos de pozos en el mapa original. Las físicas, a su vez, complementan a las habilidades y el mapa, siendo extremadamente detalladas y retroactivas. Hay tantas cosas para decir sobre este juego, pero intenté resumirlo en un párrafo. Simplemente alucinante en todos los aspectos (incluso la música y la dirección de arte por dios!), y uno de los mejores, sino el mejor juego de la historia. 15/10

items.quote: Virtually flawless. The Legend of Zelda benefits from one fact that many titles as of late have been neglecting. It is a video game FIRST, and a dang good one at that. Tears of the Kingdom fully embraces its vast world of discovery, mystery, and treasure in ways that seemed impossible before. Its story is even more compelling than its predecessor, your new abilities are game-altering with tons of player-agency, and the world is somehow even more massive and ACTUALLY FILLED WITH THINGS TO DO than it was before. Though its performance leaves a lot to be desired on the docked version of the Switch, that says more about the console than it does the game itself. This is a $70 game that is truly worth its asking price. 10/10!

items.quote:
Gioco bellissimo, open world fantastico con un'infinita quantità di cose possibili, dall'esplorare e combattere a cavallo godendosi hyrule, al creare congegni zonau di ogni tipo (da trasporto o da guerra).
La storia è decisamente attraente, specialmente con i filmati con la voce dei ****; si può cucinare di tutto, da semplici ricette per curarsi, a pozioni e ricette più complesse per potenziare i cavalli (il mio cavallo preferito è potenziaro tutto 5 stelle).
I poteri del braccio destro sono fighissimi, sì può costruire di tutto, attaccare bombe alle freccie, scalare senza problemi con ascensus e far tornare in faccia il barile esplosivo che il capo boblin cerca di lanciarti addosso.
La battaglia finale è TROPPO emozionante, specialmente la battaglia con il drago oscuro.
Queste sono solo poche cose di ciò che si può fare nel gioco, che non annoia mai.
Un bel 10 è più che meritato.

Также отлично работает физика, есть удобный крафт, тебе не тычат в лицо вопросиками, полно врагов и боссов, классаня композиция, полно озвучке на разных языках. И это не все, что я хотел бы перечислить. Зельда Tears of the kingdom это не просто продолжение битвы за 70$, это качественый, полноценный, с кучей приятных и полезных изменений, а также более проработаным сюжетом, возможностями, миром и с добавкой неплохого крафта. Эта игра заслуживает 10/10 и по моему мнению является лучшей игрой за всë время.

items.quote: Basically, it's Breath of the Wild, but a lot better. There's so much more to do in TotK. Two brand new areas to explore, on top of the original map being made a new experience again. The side quests are more fun as well. Combat has quality of life improvements. The hand abilities are a lot better than BotW's shekiah slate powers. Ultrahand lets me mess around in all kinds of new ways, like driving across large stretches of land, and kill monsters in new ways. Fuse fixed the weapon durability problem. There is one weakness in gameplay: the sage abilities are more gimmicky and less practical (exception being the wind one). The story is an improvement over BotW (mainly due to the tear memories, rather than Link's own quest) but still a bit lacking. The dungeons are decent, with proper elemental themes returning, as well as unique bosses (rather than the boring Blight Ganons in BotW). The finale is pure greatness, and Ganondorf has had his best showing to date.

items.quote: 一进游戏就立马勾起了荒野之息的回忆，果不其然还是一如既往的好玩上瘾。比起前作本作在文本故事性做足了功课，主线结局实在是震撼且有共鸣。另外各种支线的小故事也颇为有趣，有种走进海拉鲁人民生活的感觉。说到开放世界，空岛部分十分好玩；但地表部分基本上就和前作一致了，略显重复；地下就不说了，过于阴间且无聊，虽说和地表反过来的设计颇为有巧思。几大神殿和前作一样保持了极高水准的设计水平，尤其是风之神殿，我用俯冲头槌破boss，完全是一种前所未见的游戏体验。最后说一下造高达，确实是神来之笔，然而不作弊的情况下升级电池和收集材料都过于痛苦，只能说更适合云多一点。

reviewedProduct.title: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

family.name: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

title.name: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

game.name: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

items.quote:
Since the release of BOTW, we never thought it could be beaten, never mind matched. However, Tears Of The Kingdom undoubtedly improves on virtually every single aspect of the game, from the core gameplay its self, to minor details within the game, truly defining it as the greatest game OF ALL TIME. 

Firstly, Tears of the Kingdom drastically improves upon the dungeons seem within Breath Of The Wild. Although the divine beasts were very good, they felt repetitive, and each one felt like a slight reskin of the other. However, in Tears Of The Kingdom we see a more traditional and unique style to the temples, each fitting their respective areas. The lightning temple, a prime example of how great the temples are, feels much more like a traditional dungeon with rooms throughout the dungeon connecting to each other to form a sensational sequence of puzzles to finish the temple. Furthermore, the journey to the temple itself is sensational, truly setting up the marvel of the temple to come. To further improve upon BOTW, the bosses are drastically improved. The fights are thrilling, entertaining and truly enhance the dungeon further. They are completely unique which makes it feel all the more special. 

Secondly, the new abilities introduced truly enhance the gaming experience. Firstly, fuse is essential to fixing the durability problem. Instead of looking for the weapons themselves, fuse allows us to create our own weapons which mean that we are focused upon the materials not the weapons. Ascend allows us to efficiently ascend through ceilings, hills, caves in order to reach another place, almost like revali’s gale. Recall is just out-right amazing. And ultra hand completely revolutionises Tears Of The Kingdom. It allows us to create and tackle the game in what ever way we want, eradication the linear aspect to any puzzle and the game in general. It brings the players imagination to life and truly changes the gameplay experience, making it better than ever. 

Thirdly, the story of TOTK is more in-depth and meaningful than before. Characters like Zelda are more developed and truly feel essential to the plot. It is all a mystery at first, and engages the reader as we slowly unveil the mystery. And, of course, the introduction of Ganondorf is genius, adding a deceitful, thrilling and powerful antagonist to the plot and giving us the greatest Zelda boss fight ever, and the greatest cinematic ending to a game in history. 

Finally, the introduction of the sky Islands and The Depths eradicate the emptiness of breath of the Wild and give us a more jam packed Hyrule. Everywhere you go, there is always a new puzzle, challenge or mystery to the game, perfecting the open world genre. 

Tears Of The Kingdom doesn’t revolutionise open world gaming, but perfects it and improves upon one the greatest games of all time. It is truly a masterpiece and a must get for any player of any console.
items.author: PointParrot

reviewedProduct.title: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

items.quote:
When people said BOTW was fun, creative, and limitless it was a flat-out lie. However, TOTK brings this duology more justice as it adds tons of new gameplay elements, more original combat, and better traversal. At its core it does remain the same though the story runs a little bit deeper which is certainly appreciated. Unfortunately, the gameplay does get boring and repetitive quickly, especially if you played BOTW. 

If you were questioning wether you needed to play the prequel before this, the answer is NO most definitely not, go straight to TOTK and never look back!

PLAY AND JUDGE

items.quote:
The Legend of Zelda is a franchise that continues to deliver to this day. Tears of the Kingdom's gameplay, despite borrowing plenty from it's predecessor, Breath of the Wild, expands on the amazing foundation with amazing gameplay, a world that is still fun to explore and satisfying puzzles.

However, the game's story fails to satisfy is many areas, the memories, unlike Breath of the Wild, are intended to be viewed in a certain order, which is not made clear to the player. This leads to the story being extremely boring and predicable if you view it in any way other than what is intended. The dungeons, while a vast upgrade from that of Breath of the Wild, have unsatisfying pay offs with all 4 being largely the same. This is a shame, as the series is largely known for it's grande and amazing stories. 

However, the story is still better than many other game, and the new features such as the depths provide many hours of exploration and enjoyment. However, the sky, shown all across advertising, failed to impress, as many are mere copies of each other and the are too disconnected from each other outside of the tutorial area.

Highly recommend, as it is a game where the flaws simply do not outweigh the extraordinary majority of the game

items.quote:
This is as close to a 10/10 as a game can get with this level of scale and adventure.

I have a lot of flaws with this game. There's too much dialogue, the UI ****, the sky islands are barren, the cutscenes for the dungeons are boring, etc. etc. etc. But all these flaws completely fail to ruin my experience with the game. 

This game gave me an emotion that no other game could have given me. I don't want to do a spoiler review but I can write so much about it. Some of my favorite moments in not only Zelda but gaming history, come from this game and it took me 150 hours to finally decide to fight Ganon. And the ending was... simply fantastic.

Maybe I'm biased or my love for the franchise blinds me to its flaws, but I have not had this much fun with a game since Mario Odyssey nor Celeste.

I don't want to write more. Just know, there are critiques one could give the game, but the highest of highs remain here and I wouldn't trade this experience for anything.

I wondered before what Breath of the Wild was missing when I played that game. It wasn't the weaker abilities; it wasn't the lackluster ending; it wasn't the empty Hyrule. It was one thing: a heart. The charisma and wit of Ocarina of Time, Majora's Mask, Wind Waker, Twilight Princess, and Skyward Sword were missing in Breath of the Wild. This game has it.

The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom... has it all. If they just tweaked a few more things and I'd give this a perfect rating

items.quote:
Tears of the Kingdom is such a massive improvement from Breath of the Wild. I was not impressed with the move from "classic" Zelda to BoTW, but ToTK is truly a fantastic game. In many ways it is the game BoTW should have been.

I almost see BoTW as a sort of beta version of ToTK. It is as if the creation of the open world and game mechanics took so much time and resources that the developers did not have time to actually fill the world with content or a story. With ToTK I feel like the mechanics and open world concept was already developed, so now they were able to focus solely on filling the world with content and a richer storyline. 

ToTK is a true pleasure to play. It is a great game with lots of fun and so much to explore.

items.quote: Esse jogo é talvez o melhor que já joguei e já vi na vida, com um mundo imenso e uma história maravilhosa, Zelda totk é a mistura perfeita de um jogo mundo aberto e linear. Zelda totk é uma melhora em todos o sentidos quanto ao botw, agora com a adição das profundezas e das ilhas no céu, o poder de exploração e a sensação de descobrimento está ainda maior, sem falar que o mapa principal (a superfície) não é exatamente igual a do jogo anterior, mesmo que em teoria fosse o mesmo. Além da exploração, a resolução de problemas e das shrines estão bem melhores, podendo ter diversas soluções para apenas um problema, e muitas vezes necessitando muita criatividade para passar por eles. E por último mas não menos importante, a história de Tears of the Kingdom está espetacular e muito mais imersiva do que nunca, com trechos emocionantes, de deixar qualquer um na ponta da cadeira. Claro que esse jogo não é perfeito, algumas críticas que tenho quanto a ele é de que se repete alguns erros de seu antecessor, não o suficiente para estragar sua jogatina mas ainda assim são meio chatinhos, os problemas mais graves que encontrei são quanto a performance do jogo, onde muitas vezes o fps cai ou para renderizar o mapa e alguns lugares o jogo tem telas de loading maiores do que o ideal, onde muitas vezes me vi pegando o celular enquanto carrega, algo que com certeza não é bom, outro ponto negativo são as profundezas, eu particularmente gostei bastante de explorar, porém preciso admitir que pode sim ser repetitivo e um problema para a maioria das pessoas. No geral The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom é um jogo espetacular e uma obra de arte, e definitivamente um dos melhores jogos de todos os tempos, como disse antes, não é perfeito, mas não acho que suas imperfeições impactam de forma muito negativa a experiência do jogador, e mesmo com esses problemas não muda a grandiosidade deste jogo incrível, e com certeza um jogo que todos que gostam de mundo aberto e uma história fenomenal devem jogar algum dia.

This game is great and all but for me this game is not even an action game, this game is just open world puzzle game. You find a shrine, it is a puzzle, to get korok seeds solve a puzzle, even finding out what to do for quests are puzzles. Even boss fights are puzzle and I hated that. Dude let me fight these mfs normally but no first you have to shoot its eye and then you can deal the damage, no you have beat 3 heads first and then you can deal the damage, otherwise they are just spamming their **** and they dont give you proper time to deal some damage. The most fair fights are lynels and they are fun and challenging. The others are just feel like you are solving puzzle over and over again and I am sick of it. Give me proper boss fights. Another problem is armor. I upgraded my armor to the highest and I didn't see the difference and it's same with weapons. At the beginning of the game I was wearing weapons with 10-15 attack and after some time it increased to 50 but I still didn't feel the difference. Because the game mechanics that are supposed to entertain you are just puzzles. Even the action itself is a puzzle, but it is supposed to be dynamic.
Anyway that's the all the complains that I have. But I understand why it has such a high score and people think it is a masterpiece and all but it is not like that for me, still a great game though.

items.quote:
This game seems to have improved on every aspects I disliked about BotW while retaining what I liked.
First, the (meaningful) reward density is much higher, which makes the game be so much more fun. This includes a better story and more interesting side quests. Second, the action possiblity are so much more satisfying. Ultrahand, fuse, and ascend open up so many possibilities and allow for creativity. This makes moving around the map and solving puzzles much more satisfying. Third, it maintains the feeling of tranquility and beauty.
I am giving this a 9 for now, but only because I want to play some more before I proclaim it as a 10/10 masterpiece. I still miss the classic Zelda music and dungeons, so maybe the next iteration can improve the game even further.

items.quote:
Good and playable,but nothing special. immortals fenyx rising was more fun than this.
A huge world with nothing interesting going on, there is no fun in exploring. All the Chests you get, have useless stuff in them, just another batch of bow/sword/shield... put them to the 50 other ones in your inventory. Having to walk to my next destination scared me more than Ganondorf and his lackeys and you know whats worse? now you get the same empty useless world in the sky and in the depths.
The Whole game felt like a chore to play. Just finished it at around 65h, not gonna continue or play the sidequests.

Pro:
- Crafting variety is huge, some ppl will love to build machines etc. (not me)
- gameplay is nice, swordplay and bow etc. is great
-love the coloring of the game
- interesting characters including both mcs and villain

con:
- cant call your horse from more than 20 meters. not gonna buy any dlc for that tbh, nintendo has to learn to build in quality of life features (they are probably scared that it would cut the playtime short if you were on horseback all the time)
- weapon durability
- weapons overall,  mastersword is probably the biggest joke ever.
the only good weapons in the game are either limited or have big debuffs... is that supposed to be fun?
- tedious sidequests, like unlocking the fairies for equipment enchancment (they should beat the guy up who came up with that idea)
- equipment enchancement costs too much, 4x upgradeable, costs 10, 50, 200, 500, so760 just for 1 piece + rare materials (so selling them is not an option, they should also beat up that guy, but is probably the same dude), 2280 rupees for just 1 set of clothing to max and there are above 15 or so sets.
- farming money/rupees is almost impossible and goes too slow, quests reward you max with 300, the gems are way to scarce and are needed for upgrading or weapon buff
- shrines are harder to find compared to botw, wasnt fun to look for them, not gonna open a gameguide for that
- depths are just pure suffering. cant see more than 5 meters ahead, gloom everywhere and mobs that either put gloom on you or oneshot you... the whole idea is nice but the realization is so bad.
- Dragontear quests should be fixed, so that you get the videos in order, mine were all over the place. so i was confused till i stopped playing and watched the whole video in order on youtube. that way i could spoil myself and also have atleast some clue what was going on
- damage scaling is very bad. i was hitting like a truck with my 70+ dmg weapon but still couldnt scratch the silver class monsters, burned many good weapons on some random mobs
- the game is trying too hard to be mysterious .. i dont want to explore everything, give me a clear line, show me where i have to go, where i can find the caves etc., the world is too big and everything looks similar so i dont wanna go to most of those places and explore them

i enjoyed the game but it had moments where i absolutely hated it.
i am glad that i played it, but i will def not preorder the next zelda title thankts to this game

reviewedProduct.title: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

family.name: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

title.name: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

game.name: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

items.quote: It irons out almost all of BotW's weaknesses.GOOD:- Gigantic open world with lots of secrets and unique caves.- A comprehensible story with an epic climax, albeit very predictable.- GANONDORF IS BACK! The final battle is epic, but simple. This is probably the way to pick up casuals and veterans alike.- The skills! Weaponfuse as well as building vehicles is great! Crafting weapons in particular is great fun. There aren't too many special fusions in the end, but it solves the problem that BotW still had. Battles are motivating. You are well rewarded and make noticeable progress without a level system.AVERAGE:- Timeback Skill - is very helpful, but also necessary in places to rewind the far-flying parts that didn't land where you physically expected them to.- Bosses - they're still not as good as they were in previous Zelda instalments, but better than the Ganon fights in ****:- Enemy Variation. BotW already had few enemies, but TotK simply has too few enemies for a game in 2023. Only a handful of new ones have been added. I would have liked more creative enemies here, especially because of Weaponfuse.- Dungeons. Someone says that the great dungeons of the good Zelda days have returned. I can't confirm that. The 4 story dungeons are even worse than the Divine Beasts. The fire and water temples in particular are just areas stuck together with no depth. The worst dungeons Zelda has ever had.- Sky Islands: Of all things, the main focus of the marketing is the weakest area in the entire game. It's more a question of how you get up there. Once you're up there, one of three copy-paste patterns awaits the player. Boring. On top of that, there is a pathetic variety of enemies up here. There are really only the small robots and maybe the occasional flying enemy.- Underground. Provides strong kicks for the first 3 hours. Then it becomes just as trivially boring as the Sky **** GO:- There's nothing worse for an open world than copying the world from the previous instalment and barely reworking it. There are caves, which are the best innovation on the surface. Everything else in the familiar open world is a bitter disappointment. Exploration is no fun. Worse still: where there was nothing in BotW, there is often nothing to be found in TotK either. So the open world degenerates even more into an Ubisoft junk world.TLDR: A masterpiece that fails due to its open world formula and doesn't make the most of its cool game design ideas.

items.quote:
While the game functions fine technically, I don't have much else positive to say. TotK is everything BotW was not, it's unrewarding, grindy, immersion-breaking, poorly written, trend-chasing, un-interactive, and, frankly, stupid. 

The core gameplay loop of exploration doesn't work without a world designed for that exploration, that the player has not experienced and does not fully understand. That was BotW innovation. TotK fails to understand this on a fundamental level to such a degree that we might even start to think BotW was a fluke. 

Beyond that, TotK's new mechanics actually negatively impact BotW's other major innovation: world interaction. Because, you no longer have to think about the terrain when you can just Ascend past it all or build a flying machine to bypass it all. It's kind of amazing how little they considered BotW when making this game.

Then, there's the story, which tries to pretend all other Zelda games never existed. BotW included, despite being a sequel. Never seen anything like it before, but it's awful.

reviewedProduct.title: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

game.name: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

items.quote:
Many people have their own criticisms of this game - the reused map, the weird storytelling, the weapon durability, the objectively empty depths, and objectively repetitive sky islands, which soured the gameplay experience for some. 

However, dropping into Hyrule for the first time in 6 years, what you are met by, are a plethora of questions - What happened to Zelda? What happened to the 4 races of hyrule? What changed? As you explore the surface of Hyrule, you never run out of questions to ask. The depths, and the sky islands, nurture this constant sense of curiosity, drawing your eyes to them, perhaps not acting as second and third maps, but rather like additional locations on the original map, fueling your imagination and curiosity. While the rewards at the end of the trail these questions lead you on may not necessarily be the best or most useful, what is fulfilling is the journey, the act of travelling, the anticipation, and the discovery along the way itself. Along with the constant discovery and exploration, there were some of the highest highlights along the way. This game is the king of setting the mood. The sounds, the atmosphere, and the visuals of the Lightning Temple, Wind Temple and Fire Temple set the mood in the best way possible, getting you ready to take on the puzzles, enemies and bosses.

This game nails the *feeling* of exploration, wonder, and curiosity, enhanced by the gorgeous artstyle and mood setting. This, is what sets this game apart, and this is what makes this game a 10/10 for me, despite all its other shortcomings.

items.quote: Tears of the Kingdom's biggest crime is the same as its predecessor: a huge emphasis on exploration but a saddening lack of meaningful discovery. Make no mistake that this is basically a copy/paste of the same framework as Breath of the Wild, but with one major difference that enhances the experience to another level: Link's new arm abilities. They can manipulate where (and even when) objects are to solve puzzles as well as jumping through ceilings as a brilliant display of vertical traversal. It's a great game, and everyone who loved Breath of the Wild will no doubt love this one as well. items.quote:
algunos lo catalogan como la segunda venida de jesucristo pero nada mas lejos de la realidad, historia mediocre y totalmente predecible inicia con link intentanto salvar a zelda de ganondorf y termina como link salvando a zelda de ganondorf, todo lo intermedio es meh esta ahi para rellenar pero no aporta realmente importancia a la historia,  no hay giros argumentales no hay una historia mas interesante es literal lo que casi todos los juegos de zelda son, el gameplay es tosco sobre todo el combate y ese inecesario y molesto control e inventario que tiene, es terrible tienes que hacer malabares con el control para cambiar a un arma a un escudo o un arco y ni se diga el terrible sistema  de combinar flechas con objetos, el mundo es enorme y vacio, si creian que elden ring era vacio, zelda es peor es mas enorme y mas vacio, el diseño de los personajes es lo mejor aunque si lo juegas en pantalla y no en version portatil con la pantalla del switch se notan de inmediato problemas de rendimiento y la calidad grafica que no es la peor pero se ve fea algunas veces, la musica esta bien, no encontre ningun tema musical relevante pero esta bien para el juego, basicamente el resumen es 

MUNDO ABIERTO ENORME Y VACIO
CONTROLES DE COMBATE HORRIBLES 
MUSICA DECENTE 
DISEÑO DE PERSONAJES DECENTE
HISTORIA PREDECIBLE Y NADA INTERESANTE

items.quote: One of the most flawed games ever made, and yet, one of the greatest ever made. Is it Breath of the Wild again? Pretty much. However, do I consider that a flaw? Absolutely not. Tears of the Kingdom is Breath of the Wild but better in almost every way. Breath of the Wild was already one of the greatest games ever made, and if this game is just that but improved and on a bigger scale with a brand new mechanic that completely re-invents the wheel, then what's not to love? The game has its flaws not because it isn't like Ocarina of Time in how it does its dungeons or story structure, instead I think ToTK's approach to dungeons are extremely valid and well-made, but it has its flaws due to some repetition in its world and poor writing in its story. Aside from that, Tears of the Kingdom is the best open world game we've seen to date.

While it suffers from a lack of story, it more than makes up for it by having over 100+ hours of genuinely good content (not including all the korok seeds) as well as extremely good building mechanics and open world. I would highly recommend it to everyone who even remotely likes open world or adventure games.

Ho adorato l'ambientazione e le isole volanti di TOTK ma soprattutto ho amato alla follia creare armi della distruzione con le nuove funzionalità di crafting. Ho inoltre apprezzato l'aggiunta delle grotte che a mio parere sono molto belle e aggiungono qualcosa in più al gioco, quanto è bello camminare per mappa per poi trovare queste grotte tutte da esplorare? Direi che è una bella sensazione.
Per tutti quelli che criticano il fatto che sia troppo simile al predecessore io rispondo che secondo me va benissimo così e poi dobbiamo anche contare il fatto che TOTK si svolge subito dopo gli avvenimenti di BOTW quindi non è che ci fosse tanto da poter cambiare. Quindi per concludere dico che TOTK è un bellissimo gioco anche se non eguaglia BOTW.

items.quote: Undoubted masterpiece, this is a large-scale work with the most advanced ideas, and people will marvel at its greatness ten years from now. Those who think BOTW is better than TOTK are simply questioning a disruptive and innovative work with the judging framework of traditional games. If the next Zelda game regresses to the level of BOTW in terms of interactive richness, it is likely to succeed, but that will be a pity for the gaming world. Ironically, unlike what many people say, the world design of TOTK and BOTW simply look the same, and every corner is completely new in terms of experience. For people who can only play games on video media, there is probably nothing new about TOTK.

reviewedProduct.title: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

family.name: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

title.name: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

game.name: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

items.quote: This was the single greatest gaming experience I have ever had. The opening sequence immediately captured me and left me wanting more. once we gained full control, learning the new mechanics of the game was absolutely delightful. ultrahand especially was the most fun i've ever had learning. The moment the great sky island is finished, the game allows you complete freedom to explore and do whatever you wish. I loved visiting locations that were present in Breath Of the Wild and seeing how the developers changed it. My love for exploration also made traveling the depths one of the most fun parts of the game. there were a ton of mines where i dug up zonaite to upgrade my batteries and every now and then, my exploration would be rewarded with a side quest, or a neat piece of armor that referenced the older zelda games. I smiled from ear to ear upon finding my first piece of the twilight princess set. And the temples for the sages were all so much fun to play through. Especially the wind temple. The atmosphere, music, and dungeon puzzles in that dungeon made me realize that this game was everything I wanted it to be. It's also insane how you can try almost anything with ultrahand and things just work. I don't know how the hell the zelda team pulled off making a game like this work for the switch in just 6 years. the parallels the drew between Zelda and Ganondorf as determined individuals willing to sacrifice everything for their goal, as well as the connection between king Rauru's ideal of what it means to be a king compared to Ganondorf's were executed masterfully. This game was an emotional roller coaster.  Absolutely my favorite game of all time and a must play for anyone who calls themselves a gamer. Not to throw shade at any of the fantastic games that are nominated for GOTY 2023 but after playing them all it feels absolutely impossible that any game other than tears of the kingdom wins. Excellent work Hidemaro Fujibayashi and the rest of your team.

items.quote:
I don't need to say any good things about this game. This is one of two GOTY contenders for me in 2023, beside Baldur Gate 3. Exploration, Characters, Worldbuilding, Crafting, Creativity. They successfully disrupted the open-world genre in the prequel, and they made it again in their crafting in this game.

The reason that I cannot give 10 is similar to Baldur Gate 3. They still have a lot of bugs since its launch (I said a lot since I see it myself in my playthrough and sometimes I cannot get past it), which is understandable since their feature is really big. It also has a minor UX where you cannot control your companion smoothly and disrupt the gameplay. This is the only thing that I see in this game.

Otherwise, If you see the trailer and you want to play it, just buy it. Quality is over the price.

reviewedProduct.title: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

items.quote:
Tears of the kingdom is one of the best games not only from Nintendo, but also in general, its mechanics such as ultra-hand or combination, are fun and easy to understand, which makes it unique, its open world despite being the same, it still feels fresh Thanks to the new sanctuaries, caves and the representation of the underground, the only thing that is not very good at all are the celestial islands, these are few, small and become repetitive, from then on it has a Quite a broad and fun exploration for which you don't know where to start.

Its story seemed somewhat simple and not very elaborate to me, it was what I had the most expectations for, the best part of the story is Zelda's sacrifice to repair the master sword for more than 10,000 years by becoming a dragon, the idea of ​​memories is not bad, it's just that it is not well captured because they were able to put an order to the memories and make them last longer, I also lack context for certain things such as a representation of the underground, how the zonnan became extinct (not counting rauru and mineru), these if we see his **** ending is excellent, it feels epic and magical, even though all the bosses are easy, the dialogues and scenes never cease to amaze, such as Ganondorf, the battle against the black dragon is beautiful, the soundtrack is wonderful and as it is In the Zelda saga, burying the master sword in the dragon to destroy the tear that started it all, making Ganondorf powerful. Breath of the Wild had a sad ending due to the death of the champions but in Tears of the Kingdom despite the death of Mineru's spirit, the post-credits scene conveys joy and peace, defeating Ganondorf, his draconic form and saving to Zelda saving her from the fall and making her Hylian again.

In conclusion, Tears of the Kingdom surpassed its predecessor in many aspects, making it a totally unique open-world video game.

items.quote: Another fun Zelda game from Nintendo, this has to be a contender for one of my favorite Zelda game from the past 10 years. The new areas and building on the old map is awesome, but occasionally some areas feel empty. The machine building and weapon crafting is fun as well, but the controls feel a little clunky. There's a tad bit too much when it comes to shrines and collectables, but those quests are mostly skipable if you don't want to do them  The item durability is less of an issue this time around, which was appreciated! I will say the story is amazing from start to finish. If you love Zelda, and if you adored BotW, this is a must play.

items.quote: A monumental follow up to The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild. Nintendo has put even more effort into creating the Sandox experience, with unbelievable mechanics that beg the question of how they managed to create this game on the Nintendo Switch. The world's size and richness have nearly tripled, and the gameplay of the basic map has also been significantly altered. The player can navigate to a substantial number of sky islands and a massive subterranean area without encountering any loading screens. In conclusion, Nintendo has succeeded in producing a game that both matched and surpassed its expectations.

items.quote:
En clair The Legend of Zelda : Tears of the Kingdom est un excellent jeu avec un travail de fou sur des éléments comme les pouvoirs qui offre tellement de possibilité que les développeurs ont prévu/laissé. Mais tout en réussissant à ce qu’il ne soient pas destructeur de l’expérience en cassant totalement le jeu. Un jeu qui vient corriger quelques soucis de son prédécesseur notamment sur les temples et leurs boss qui possède plus d’identité. Qui propose une histoire plus intéressante, des musiques toujours aussi bien travaillé comme son univers. Bien que la formule soit conservée et toujours au top on ressent trop que c’est une suite directe. Avec trop de nombreux manques d’ambition sur certains aspects, surtout avec 7 ans de développement derrière, soit plus qu’entre Skyward Sword et Breath of the Wild. Un bestiaire trop inchangé, des îles et souterrains sous exploité ou encore des boss qui manque de puissance.

Avis complet : ****/2023/09/04/avis-the-legend-of-zelda-tears-of-the-kingdom/

items.quote:
So much busy work. So. Much. Time. Wasting. 
How many times do I need to see the same temple cut scene? I don't care about the poor dialogue from unmemorable NPCs. 
To make it worse, for a hand-held console game, the button mapping is a nightmare. It tries to do so much and we're given so little, an octopus would have a hard time trying to juggle all the different controls you need to remember and execute simultaneously. Why is "send a giant annoying opaque rock monster flying, exploding everything in its path" the same freaking button as "pick up this exploding plant" This only get more annoying with the ever expanding crowd of opaque **** crowding Link doing nothing but block his view and slightly improve the meaningless busy-work that needs to be done. 
All in all it's a collection of colourful fetch quests in large open spaces by Nintendo. Play it on a plane.

items.quote: Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom is a colossal misstep that strays so far from the beloved formula of the Zelda series that it feels like a different, inferior game altogether. The uninspired narrative, lackluster visuals, poorly implemented open-world mechanics, and technical shortcomings collectively make Tears of the Kingdom the worst entry in the Zelda franchise, tarnishing the legacy of a series that has long been celebrated for its innovation, charm, and timeless appeal.

items.quote:
It's clearly a masterpiece. I thought it was impossible to get much better than Zelda Breath of The Wild, but Tears of The Kingdom made BOTW a demo tech game. I'm a long time Zelda fan and TOTK is now my favorite game of all times.

If you're a Zelda fan, you must play this game, if you've never played Zelda before, give this title a try, it can be the first Zelda experience you need, otherwise, try Skyward Sword and other 3D Zelda games first. 

Totk is definately a GOTY for me, or should I say GOTD/GOTG - game of the decade, game of the generation. 

Hope you'll get the same incredible adventure I had with this game.

items.quote: I don’t know where to start when I heard they were making a sequel of breath of the wild I was not excited at all I hated the very idea of this game because I thought Nintendo was just trying to make a quick money grab because breath of the wild was so successful so I thought this game was going to be mediocre at best. I was not hyped at all for this game. But when it released, I just bought it so I could give it a try and man was I wrong about it, They really put everything into this game. I think this is breath of the wild, truly realized this might sound like a stretch, but it might be the legend of Zelda truly realize with the overwhelmingly huge map, the freedom on how to play the game, the story, and links new abilities This game takes game of the year. Yes the frame rate is bad but and it doesn’t perform like a next gen game should but that’s not what makes a game a game I mean look at Minecraft it’s considered the greatest game of all time yet its graphics are terrible graphics don’t matter and frame rate doesn’t matter either yeah don’t get me wrong though I played spider man 2 and that game has some crispy visuals and I wish totk did run at 60 frames but that should not hold this game back form being game of the year it’s about what you do in the game itself in tears of the Kingdom you can approach any situation in your own unique way for example, you don’t have to draw your sword to kill enemies. You can create a car that has a Canon attached to it and below enemies up from a distance, or attach a flamethrower to your shield to burn your enemies while also protecting your self  there is literally endless ways to go about the game and that’s scratching the surface and I’m not exaggerating. This game is overwhelmingly huge this game will reward your from being curious and taking risks and I can not count how many times I stumbled on a key item or powerful upgrade just because I was curious about a location or something interesting I saw in the distance like I got go important items in that game on accident because I was just messing around in the open world and that’s how an open world games is supposed to be you should be encouraged to be experimental and curious There’s so much to do in this game. The story is also better than breath of the wild in my opinion, because the stories one big mystery and you have to put the pieces together or not it’s completely optional if you what know to know secrets and lore details that game gives your nothing you gotta go out there and get it yourself and that’s a great thing solving puzzle's has so much freedom to it there’s not jut  way to solve a puzzle there are multiple ways to solve one puzzle out of hundreds you’ll face, in most games puzzles are linear. There’s only one way to solve them and that’s not a bad thing, but totk gives the player the freedom to solve a puzzle in your unique way it’s amazing sorry I know that sounds corny and it’s OK if this game doesn’t win game of the year I’m just happy I was able to play it I have 160 hours in and I’m ready to play 160 more. I know this was like an essay so if you made it this far, thank you for reading. I really appreciate it and have a wonderful day and I hope you’re having just as much fun on thismarvelous game as I am.

items.quote:
Simply put- the best game ever made. It’s so good that its flaws become irrelevant. Exploration and creativity have never been better applied to a video game. It takes everything BOTW was and tops it. 

Ultrahand is the greatest gaming mechanic ever made. It adds an unprecedented level of creativity and interactivity. There’s nothing more fun or engaging than designing a machine, device, or item to accomplish or reach something. It along with fuse lead the list that adds up to the best set of abilities Zelda has ever had. 

It’s almost inconceivable that arguably the most massive open world game ever made was pulled off on such obsolete hardware with so little compromises. The graphics are somehow immersive and fantastic as a result of Nintendo’s doctorate in cartoon worlds and knowing what makes graphics look good and bad. With that said, I’d still love to see what Nintendo could do with identical hardware to PS5 and Series X. 

I spent over 700 hours on this game because I didn’t want it to end and because there’s that much to do in it. 

My only real complaints are that the coordinates should’ve had a movable reticle that shows it’s locations rather than yours, the hero’s quest tracker was too short and should’ve been limitless, that the game could have had a more organized and extensive tracking of true 100% completion and central hub featuring several hundred categories (you can add hundreds of hours to a game by simply creating more to complete), the lack of a meter that shows a weapon’s or shield’s degradation, and the main dungeons should’ve been self contained and lengthier. All that said, as I noted above it’s so good it makes these complaints completely irrelevant. 

At the end of the day, like BOTW it’s as good as gaming gets and further proof Nintendo is untouchable when it comes to game design. I just hate that there’s such an extensive wait in between titles. If only gaming had the same delivery time as TV shows. Imagine a world where we get one Zelda per year or every other year.

items.quote: In the enchanting realm of Zelda, there exists a kingdom that captivates the imagination and tugs at the heartstrings—the Kingdom of Tears. This ethereal land, bathed in the soft hues of an eternal sunset, is a testament to the sublime beauty that arises from the fusion of myth and **** Kingdom of Tears, a jewel nestled between rolling hills and crystalline lakes, unfolds like a dreamscape painted with the palette of a master artist. Its very essence seems to be woven from the threads of fantasy, where every glimmering tear that graces its landscapes tells a tale of unparalleled wonder.Picture a realm where emerald-green meadows stretch out like a welcoming carpet, kissed by the golden rays of a perpetually setting sun. Flowers of every hue bloom in harmonious symphony, reflecting the vibrancy of life that pulses through this fantastical kingdom. The air is infused with a fragrance so sweet, it is said to be the essence of the tears shed by the princess in the ancient **** the heart of the Kingdom of Tears stands a palace of mesmerizing beauty, its spires reaching toward the heavens. It is here that the tragic love story unfolds—a narrative of star-crossed lovers whose passion transcends the boundaries of time. The tears shed by the princess, crystallized in the kingdom's stones, glisten like diamonds, casting a radiant glow that bathes the entire realm in an otherworldly **** day gives way to night, the Kingdom of Tears transforms into a celestial masterpiece. The tears, now illuminated by the silvery light of the moon, create a spectacle that leaves visitors breathless. It is a realm where fantasy and reality converge, and the echoes of the princess's lament become a hauntingly beautiful melody that lingers in the air.Travelers who venture into the Kingdom of Tears find themselves bewitched by its spell, not merely by its visual splendors but by the palpable sense of magic that permeates every corner. It is a place where dreams are born, and where the very air seems to shimmer with the promise of **** the grand tapestry of Seldara's legends, the Kingdom of Tears emerges as a jewel—a beacon of beauty, resilience, and the enduring power of love. It invites all who dare to dream to step into its embrace and be transported to a realm where tears are not just symbols of sorrow but also tokens of a love that defies the boundaries of time and reality.

items.quote: I really wanted to love TOTK. While the game is wonderful and nostalgic on its own, I cannot shake the feeling of general disappointment. The incredible draw and magic of BOTW lies in a world undiscovered, the melancholic yet absolutely liberating feeling that you're one with the wild, seeing what's beyond every hill, lake, cliffside, spark in the distance. TOTK doesn't have that feeling anymore because the main map has already been explored in the previous game, and both the sky islands and the depths are not real worlds with complex biomes, objectives, and stories for you to want to explore. They're just filler environments, stretched for the sake of expanding the worlds. They're not that rewarding or exciting to discover as a whole. The memory aspect also doesn't fit with TOTK, and the story line falls under the same formula as BOTW, which does not work in the context of TOTK. Although the weapons, combat, runes, gameplay elements are new and exciting and innovative, the core meat of the game (story, world exploring), are just not enough to make this game great. In summary, TOTK doesn't capture the magic and awe that BOTW has in its open world concept , doesn't have elements from previous zelda games that make up for it (story is weak, dungeons are weaker), and the innovative aspects of the game (building, interesting runes), are just not nearly enough to make this game a truly spectacular standalone zelda game.

items.quote: Strong proposition from Nintendo who doubles down on the Breath of the wild recipe, with added mechanics but overall same game structure in almost every aspect (shrines, 4 abilities, 4 main temples, … the list goes on).I have to praise how innovative Nintendo developers have been while using the same basics. The player will experience again the joys of discovering abilities and find fun and exciting ways to use and mix them to solve puzzles.A good thing is the emphasis on the story structure, which was not really the case with the previous game (pretty lackluster in that regard). The map is also more filled with caves, wells, enemies, things to build with abilities etc… Some stuff feels dispensable to be honest.Given the fact that there are skies and souterrains now, I would even say that the game feels a bit bloated but this gives gamers a lot of hours to enjoy their game (only if they like to do the same thing again and again …).What bugs me the most in that game is not related to its content or structure. It has to do with the techinical capabilities of the console.I find it concerning that this game is so strongly hindered by Nintendo’s unwilingness to provide a console on par with the ambitions of the developers. The framerate, the resolution are just horrible for a 2023 game and although I enjoy the game, I find it too bad that it is not able to express its qualities, merely because the hardware on which it is delivered is way passed obsolete. This struck me as soon as I played the prologue, as I found the eery autumnal ambience and tone particularly well done, if not burdened by slobbery textures and unsteady framerate. But this initial impression stuck with me for the total duration of my playthrough. And it even got worse as you get companions later on, which makes the Switch struggle like hell.A videogame, albeit very good at its core, can not be good when it is not playable, sorry. Please update your hardware and respect your franchise with a console able to support it.
items.author: GentleCat

reviewedProduct.title: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

family.name: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

title.name: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

game.name: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

items.quote:
Strong proposition from Nintendo who doubles down on the Breath of the wild recipe, with added mechanics but overall same game structure in almost every aspect (shrines, 4 abilities, 4 main temples, … the list goes on).
I have to praise how innovative Nintendo developers have been while using the same basics. The player will experience again the joys of discovering abilities and find fun and exciting ways to use and mix them to solve puzzles.
A good thing is the emphasis on the story structure, which was not really the case with the previous game (pretty lackluster in that regard). The map is also more filled with caves, wells, enemies, things to build with abilities etc… Some stuff feels dispensable to be honest.
Given the fact that there are skies and souterrains now, I would even say that the game feels a bit bloated but this gives gamers a lot of hours to enjoy their game (only if they like to do the same thing again and again …).

What bugs me the most in that game is not related to its content or structure. It has to do with the techinical capabilities of the console.
I find it concerning that this game is so strongly hindered by Nintendo’s unwilingness to provide a console on par with the ambitions of the developers. The framerate, the resolution are just horrible for a 2023 game and although I enjoy the game, I find it too bad that it is not able to express its qualities, merely because the hardware on which it is delivered is way passed obsolete. This struck me as soon as I played the prologue, as I found the eery autumnal ambience and tone particularly well done, if not burdened by slobbery textures and unsteady framerate. But this initial impression stuck with me for the total duration of my playthrough. And it even got worse as you get companions later on, which makes the Switch struggle like hell.

A videogame, albeit very good at its core, can not be good when it is not playable, sorry. Please update your hardware and respect your franchise with a console able to support it.

items.quote:
The game itself is amazing. The new abilities really make for a fun sandbox adventure game. The physics in the game are actually pretty awesome and overall I've enjoyed it like crazy.

My biggest problem is that the game isn't optimized enough. Well there's that, and that the game is just too big for the switch at this point. Whenever i'm having an awesome time, i'll be pulled back to reality by fps drops down to the 20s sometimes depending what i'm doing. 
Almost always when I open up the ultrahand ability to move objects there is some lagg in handheld mode, just for a moment but it shouldn't be there at all in my opinion.

TLDR; Game is great! Price is Steep! Performance is just bad on handheld - This one would definitely have benefited massively from new hardware

items.quote: This is the most innovative game I have ever played. I missed out on Breath of the Wild until a year after its release, so I didn't get that magic of exploring Hyrule completely blind without any spoilers. After having played Tears of the Kingdom completely blind, I now understand what the big deal was. Except now, you have so much more freedom in movement and altitude, which makes exploring all the more fun. Things like farming dragon parts were made so much easier, because of the freedom of the sky the game gives you. Also, I like how they developed the story and the relationship between Link and Zelda. Breath of the wild was lauded as one of the greatest games ever(rightfully so), but Tears of the Kingdom takes it to a whole other level.

items.quote: It's effectively just Breath of the Wild but better in every way. Better side quests, better visuals, better abilities, better story, better shrines, better enemy variety, a better world, and more content to sink your teeth into if you're a completionist. However, two things hold the game back. The first one is the UI, which is extremely clunky when doing things like fighting alongside sages or attaching items to your bow. The second major issue is that the game is on the Nintendo Switch. I love the Switch, but it can barely handle this game and its innovative mechanics. Frame drops are the norm and not being able to experience this game in 4k 60fps means part of the world's beauty is lost. Despite that though, the new mechanics alone could warrant buying the game since they are unbelievably fun to mess around with for hours.

items.quote:
The Legend Of Zelda Tears of the Kingdom SIGNIFICANTLY improves all aspects of the previous entry and continues to bring what made BOTW a great game with it’s story mechanics and voice acting. However in this entry with the nearly 7 year old system that is powering the game, the mechanics sometimes struggle to truly live up to modern day games. The game suffers performance issues that modern day gaming would find atrocious and absurd. Combat in the game has not improved much for the entry and the enemies are mostly familiar. It’s quite unreasonable the charge that Nintendo is offering for the game. What this game really delivers on in the other hand no pun intended is ultra hand, this new ability can stick almost anything together. Players have created such monstrosity’s like mechs to cars. This is an unusual mechanic to this series however the way it’s used and the endless possibilities are truly what make this game shine including a world that has tripled.

VERDICT: The Legend of Zelda Tears of The Kingdom is full of fun surprises in a familiar place. The game is full of tech issues, however with the addition of Ultrahand brings a whole new light to this game.
Due to the Nintendo consoles lack of performance the game remains a last gen experience that may not be suitable for most gamers, Nintendo Switch Fans will find this possibly the greatest Switch Game of All Time.

7.5/10 Great!

items.quote:
Review in Portuguese.
Tears of the Kingdom parece viver à sombra do seu predecessor, trazendo inovações que, embora interessantes, não justificam completamente o preço integral do jogo. Entre as novidades, os novos poderes e a mecânica de construção são os pontos altos, sendo implementados de maneira criativa e eficaz. No entanto, outras adições deixam a desejar. 
O novo mapa, chamado Depths, é notavelmente vazio e repetitivo, dando a impressão de ter sido incluído apenas para justificar a existência de uma nova área no jogo. As ilhas no céu também são escassas e, em grande parte, se assemelham umas às outras, o que diminui a sensação de variedade e exploração. 
A trama é envolvente, mas não traz nada de realmente inovador, seguindo uma estrutura de missões semelhante ao jogo anterior. Para um título desse porte, esperava-se uma abordagem mais inovadora e cativante.
Em relação aos gráficos, o jogo mantém o belo estilo de arte do seu antecessor, mas, em algumas ocasiões, parece até pior, o que é decepcionante, especialmente considerando que o jogo foi lançado para o Nintendo Switch. A escolha de um console limitado pela própria Nintendo não justifica totalmente esse retrocesso visual.
A trilha sonora é um ponto forte, com composições fantásticas e emocionantes, embora uma parte significativa delas seja reaproveitada do jogo anterior. 
Em resumo, Tears of the Kingdom é um jogo competente, mas é difícil ignorar a falta de inovação em muitos aspectos. É decepcionante ver um título tão esperado reciclar elementos sem trazer melhorias significativas. Ainda assim, ele oferece uma experiência sólida para os fãs da série, mesmo que deixe a sensação de que poderia ter sido muito mais do que é.

items.quote:
+ The map has changed at least some what so there is a little of what made Breath of the Wild great, discovering things.
- The game reuses too much from Breath of the Wild.
- The puzzle range from extremely good to extremely bad and too many of them require the painful building to progress.
- The worst aspect of BotW was the weapon breaking and for some reason it's in this game too.
- Adds horrible areas above that are a pain to get to and around.
- Adds bland dark largely empty areas underground.
- Adds vehicles that are a pain to build and horrible to control.
- The vehicle parts are not easiy enough to get.
- The story isn't very good and the quests are not always very clear.
= The game is too much like Breath of the Wild which was a great game but everything that's new is horrible and they make the game painful to play. The reason my review is so late, despite getting the game at launch is simply that I have struggled to play it because I keep losing interest in it. It's so painful to be in the sky and to tediously build a flying machine that you struggle to control and the battey runs out so your stopping and starting and then for it's life span to end on you half way across and you then fall to the ground. The game does have it's moments where it's a 10 out of 10 but those moments are surrounded by alot of boring and frustrating gameplay.

items.quote:
GOTY 2023.
Zelda TOTK superou minhas expectativas e se tornou o melhor jogo que eu ja joguei na vida. Todas as criticas envolvendo o BOTW ficam extremamente irrelevantes quando se trata de TOTK. Esse jogo não somente superou o seu antecessor como também impulsionou e transformou positivamente tudo o que conheci em BOTW. Zelda TOTK aprimora o combate, revoluciona a exploração e os puzzles (que são incríveis), e, acima de tudo, contém uma lore magnífica e muito bem roteirizada. A historia de TOTK esta em outro nível! Eu realmente fiquei impressionado com a diferença entre os games, porque em BOTW o mundo era vasto mas ao mesmo tempo era vazio, a historia era boa, mas ao mesmo tempo era comum, enquanto em TOTK o mundo ganha vida. As sky islands, o underground, a exploração da superfície, a utilização de tudo que está em sua volta para solucionar as dificuldades de exploração... tudo está extremamente bem feito e bem planejado. Os novos poderes: ultra hand, fuse, ascend, recall... TODOS são incríveis. Tudo em Zelda TOTK é incrível, surpreendente, completo, magnífico, e, acima de tudo, MONUMENTAL. Acima de GOTY, esse jogo é o melhor de todos os tempos. ZELDA TEARS OF THE KINGDOM É MONUMENTAL.

items.quote:
This game is just OK. Much worse than Breath otw .the resons why:
-its a copy of BOTW world, assets, ideas and storyline (go to 4 regions, finish the puzzle, fight the boss go to hyrule castle after and finish the game )
-All shrine puzzles are extremely easy and half of them dont even have any puzzles.
-companions are frustrating to use, very often there is no even point to try to use them as its causing more bad than good. Not to mentiin that their powers are almost useless (only 2 can be useful in exploration only ) 
- exploration is very superficial due to building system and fast travel, horse is used only for few side quests which demands it.
-no upgrade to weapons/armor system
-depths are almost empty, sky can be done in few hours, which means not much more areas to explore
-all treasure chests have nothing interesting in them

Imho this game is another robbery and i predict there will be no more good zeldas anytime soon.

items.quote: One of the most frustrating games I have ever played. I absolutely hated my time trying to finish this game. BOTW was freeing by allowing you to explore an open world with more options, but this game feels stuck in quicksand, by slowing down your advancement through the game. Weapon degradation is far worse here and the solution is to make you take extra steps to fuse items which leads to more menus and less fluidity. Ultrahand is incredibly frustration. The game would've been much more enjoyable if the structures were already built to explore and ride lifts through the air and explore instead of awkward rotation to put together annoying pieces. Dialogue was horrendous. The text boxes were extremely slow and overly verbose without saying anything slightly interesting for an adult. The voice acting is very annoying childish. The intro keeps taking control out of your hands. The map is frustrating to explore, because you've already explored it and aren't gaining anything new. You're just redoing it. Again. But slower. I absolutely hate this game.

items.quote:
It's a great, fun and beautiful sandbox action game, but I long for the days when Nintendo valued story and lore. I think there's been a Mario-fication of the Zelda series and the developers have even stated that the story isn't critical to Zelda games, but I'd argue that the story is what has always driven interest in it. Look at any Zelda fan forum or site and they're overflowing with analyses of the story and the lore.

TOTK's gameplay is undoubtedly great, but I found the main story once again left a lot to be desired. I found much more joy in the side quests (like Lurelin village) and general exploration. My advice is to avoid the main story as much as possible and explore the game. The end of the game felt rushed and like an afterthought, unlike the beginning, so don't hurry to the end.

Are we ever going to have instruments and great music in Zelda games again? I sure hope so. TOTK is a wonderful game, and it sounds like it's the formula that Nintendo is going to use going forward, but I pray for a better story and music in the next one. I don't know how Nintendo can look at the success of Elden Ring, a brand new IP, and keep saying that story isn't important for the Zelda series.

items.quote: I didn’t even think it was possible to make a Breath of the Wild sequel that could outperform the original, speaking of how phenomenal it was, but here I am! I’ve had the game since May but I’ve only just now finished the main story as there is so much fun around the world to do. From exploring, to side quests, to collecting, to fighting, to building with the new Ultrahand ability, this is one of the biggest games I’ve ever played! I have put in over 500 hours to this work of art and it is ABSOLUTELY worth it! I never really had any problems with this game either, some aren’t a fan of the 30 FPS frame-rate but not once did I notice nor did I care about it. The game has so much more to offer than just frames that it really makes that “flaw” feel irrelevant. It’s not a surprise this is one of the highest rated games of all time, it is a work of art that I wish I could play for the first time again! This is the best thing I’ve ever spent $70 on. This is easily game of the year!

game.name: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

items.quote: Story is absolutely fantastic, however I do feel as some parts are a bit too much, example being the Great Sky Island. The Sages also **** (minus Tulin), but the final boss fight of the game is absolutely amazing! The fact that Ganondorf can flurry rush you and his healthbar goes off center is stuff that makes the final moments all worth playing for. However, the reward for all 156 Shrines kind of **** and same with the lightroots. The abilities are also way better than BotW's. Fuse and Ultrahand just feel weird to not have. The dungeons, while they are still significantly better than Breath of the Wild's, aren't as good as the ones from older Zelda games. The Wind Temple is a big one, as the whole thing was just a massive pain to deal with, but not all of them are bad. The Lightning Temple was amazing, and the Seized Construct battle in the Spirit Temple was hilarious to me. It's amazing but needs a few tweeks here and there.

items.quote:
Yes, they reused BOTW map, but they changed, added so much to it: underworld, sky islands, and tons of caves (filled with materials). The new mechanisms (fuse, zonai builds) adds so much variety in the way to handle battles and at times exploration. Along with the new items' usage, these new features overall extends greatly over BOTW the number of methods at disposal to solve problems. Creativity runs wild thanks to Zonai builds allowing for almost unlimited possibilities. As a result, some shrines can be solved in multiple ways. The fantastic physics unique to this game will be talked about years and years after. You might surprise yourself when trying to build a cutomized machine, not knowing if your machine is built properly and is working as intended. You get sometimes this "Aha" moment when you find out it actually works or how it should work. Then you go wild testing and destroying any moving living things (no I didn't say Koroks, though I could...).

The final boss fight might be one of the most memorable fighting moments I have ever witnessed.

On the downside, the sky islands are sometimes a bit empty and there are repeat locations in the depth (e.g., Yiga hideout and monster mining camp) but there are also tons of good surprises in the skies (dungeons, starview, zonaite forge) and in the depth (bosses, coliseums, labyrinths, spirits, abandoned mines, all the areas surrounding fire temple).

items.quote:
People are going too soft on this game since it got review-bombed with 10s at the start and they're probably afraid of offending people. It's not just - "Im too old for this!" (Thats an excuse to calm the internet). As a 26-year-old, I can still enjoy many other games with more intensive puzzle mechanics/building. A game where I have to watch a youtube video to make every contraption I need to make is a bad game. I get absolutely no reward for tediously gluing parts together for hours so to complete this slog I just ended up climbing and using stamina potions just like the last game. Call me an idiot, but I don't have time to keep failing, and failing just to save another Korok and get two pieces of poop. I've been a Zelda fan for decades and played and enjoyed every title thus far (even BOTW! Though I enjoyed it less than many others). TOTK is "fun" in the sense that sometimes I feel like I get to do something interesting, but lets face it - for the most part this game is a puzzle/engineering sim THEMED with Zelda. And if you dont like spending hours upon hours doing literal work for minor rewards, this game isn't for you. We watched people playing it online - tons of videos with robots shooting lasers from their nether regions and thought haha! That looks fun. But the strangest thing happened. My partner and I get the game, played for an afternoon, and then moved on with our lives. Then I went to plug in my Wii and play Twilight Princess again ;) When the hype clears and your depression over the world's events has its upturn - which game do you return to? Probably not TOTK.
Also where's this metacritic score coming from? 96? Really? That is hilarious. Nice job lining your pockets with Nintendo money.

items.quote: If you compare TOTK to BOTW, then yes TOTK beats BOTW overall. But TOTK feels like a very solid expansion pack of the previous game. Exploration has been ramped up, story expanded in a very satisfying way and core gameplay loop remains the same. Biggest milestone is the new feature of utilizing your surroundings to merge weapons and create various tools for transport and destruction. A fantastic addition to the general gameplay. And exploring the various levels was a blast. While the game definitely amazed me, it lacked for me the same WOW factor I experienced with BOTW. In some sense its suffering from its own previous success. I hope they continue with this format of Zelda games, but if they do so completely different map.

game.name: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

items.quote: This game is a milestone for the Zelda franchise as a whole, as it builds on the environment already established in Breath of the Wild, but also incorporates elements of older Zelda games within it. Tears of the Kindgom’s story is also unbelievable in its own right. Although it retains the same format of storytelling from Breath of the Wild, that being explaining the narrative through events that occur in the past, it subverted my expectations with its intriguing ideas. Furthermore, the gameplay is outstanding, for it allows the player to make the game as creative and fun as they want it to be. Instead of making a set of rules that the player must follow to accomplish tasks, they said, “Here,  YOU figure out YOU want to solve this problem.” Overall, Tears of the Kingdom fixes most of Breath of the Wild’s problems, and outshines it in many ways. I strongly recommend this game if you haven’t played it already.

items.quote: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom is a master when it comes to exploration,gameplay,interaction,story telling,art direction,beautiful visuals,great music and many other features that made the game great and come out as one of the greatest game of all time.Totk is a perfect sequel from its first succesor botw and i gotta say its far better than botw.With it's new gameplay mechanic like rewinding objects,ascending through floors,sticking object to another object which what made the gameplay so good and a game changer. On the other hands,the map got expanded even more and added some new exploration place such as the depth and the sky that has a lot of content to be experienced and to keep you entertained especially the depth. But one thing that kind of bothered me was the 30fps despite the switch limitation hardware, it'd been a better experience if its a 60fps and i hope that the next gen console have backwards compatibility so that i can enjoy this masterpiece in 60 frames per seconds and 4k! So far i've spent about 100+ hours in this game and i still haven't fully completed the game yet because there are just too many content to ****'s a 10/10 for me and i am loving it so far,i am looking forward for a game like this in the future! :) (sorry if bad english) ;^)

reviewedProduct.title: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

family.name: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

title.name: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

game.name: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

items.quote:
Clairement le meilleur Zelda auquel j’ai pu jouer. Cependant, cela est sûr et certain que les personnes ayant déjà été sceptiques sur le nouveau format que le dernier opus avait apporté le resteront. Oui le jeu est une extension de Breath Of The Wild étant une suite DIRECTE de ce dernier, cela ne veut en rien dire que le jeu lui est une copie sans ajout de contenus. AU CONTRAIRE.
Ce jeu, c’est Breath Of The Wild, avec les **** soucis en moins et un contenu MONSTRE.
Les sanctuaires sont pour certains plus faciles pour d’autres plus difficiles, ce qui est sûr, c’est que la possibilité de faire chaque énigme de la façon dont on le souhaite est fabuleuse.
De plus le marketing de Nintendo en ne montrant que l’espace céleste était réellement réussi, quelle était ma surprise lors de ma découverte des profondeurs qui font la taille de la map entière de BOTW avec une ambiance étonnamment étrange, sombre voire même horrifique.
Pour les amateurs de musique de jeux vidéo là aussi pour moi, c’est un carton plein, que dire tout est bien géré, autant dans le réarrangement de musique des précédents opus que dans les nouvelles productions alors merci à Koji Kondo et à son équipe de compositeur.
L’histoire, elle, a été étoffée surtout comparée à son désormais petit frère BOTW, même si on aimerait en avoir plus sous les dents, mais finalement les histoires des Zelda ne sont pas si remplies que ça, et je trouve ça bien dommage.
Bref.
C’est un excellent jeu, j’ai réussi à retrouver la surprise et l’émerveillement que Breath Of The Wild m’avait apporté.
J’ai adoré ce virage qu’a pris l’équipe Zelda avec ce format. Je suis d’autant plus heureux qu’ils aient choisi de sortir un BOTW 2.
En résumé, foncez si vous avez adoré Breath Of The Wild, essayez si vous n’avez pas joué à BOTW et je vous déconseille si vous avez détesté Breath Of The Wild car force est de constater que c’est une suite.

items.quote:
one of the best games i’ve ever played.
As a musician i loved the new themes the composers gave us and the sound design is
almost immaculate. The story is not a ground breaking idea, but it works very, very well.
One thing i didn’t really like was the depths, not as a design nor as an idea, the real issue with it is purely personal and subjective, i don’t really like the idea of roaming in the dark, matter of fact i tried to stay out of it as much as i could, but nonetheless i enjoyed the quests inside the depths. The sky islands are not a giant map, still fantastic design and awesome music, a really enchanting atmosphere. Overall this game is one of the greatest experiences i’ve had on a nintendo console, and one of the best in general, a true must play of modern gaming.

items.quote:
ToTK It's basically Breath Of The Wild, but enhanced, not just in the game mechanics, but also in the performance, gameplay, art and so on.

For me, it's an incredible game, I had very good times with it and I even finished it with the 70% of the total content done. But the waiting for the game release have been long and, unfortunatelly, for me it doesn't really deserve it.

I must be from that group of people that they don't like the new creative tools, but what can I say! I didn't really use the tools for displacements or other purposes, because at the end of the day I use the same 2-3 ways to explore, combat or move.

And it's cool that now people have new ways for being creative, but I feel like we didn't need so much 'freedom'. Also, the world is bigger, but the space between every 'content area' stills big too. I know that there are hardware limitations, but you can make more with less space.

Tears of The Kingdom It's an awesome adventure and I'm excited to see what's next but, for me, doesn't deserve the GOTY.

items.quote: Sadly, this game was ultimately a let down for me. I had this hyped up way too much based on how fun the last one was, albeit with its own gripes. However, this one is way too identical to the breath of the wild. I mean right down to the story progression, layout of land, order in which you go abouts ( go to 4 places come back to castle) it's ridiculous. Graphics are decent but showing it's age. That doesn't bother me nearly as much as the building though. It gets tedious. This just felt like huge DLC with way too overfamiliar land, mechanics and plot.Still enjoyable but once I finished main quest, I was done with these two games. Enough is enough how long can you milk it?
