items.quote: La saga más legendaria de los videojuegos vuelve a hacer historia una vez más con una aventura colosal revolucionaria única y prácticamente perfecta que eleva la diversión y la libertad del jugador a un nivel sin **** nuevo en Tears of the Kingdom son los dispositivos Zonai,que el jugador puede usar para combate,propulsión, exploración y **** runas del juego anterior se reemplazan con cinco nuevos poderes:Ultramano Fusión,Ascender,Retroceso y el **** Ultramano le permite al jugador recoger y mover diferentes objetos y unir diferentes objetos.Esto se puede usar con los dispositivos Zonai para crear diferentes vehículos u otras construcciones.Fusión le permite a Link combinar materiales, equipos o ciertos objetos del mundo en un escudo o arma para aumentar sus atributos y **** ejemplo fusionar un objeto explosivo con una flecha hará que la flecha explote al impactar. Autoconstruir recrea instantáneamente un dispositivo creado con Ultramano a costa de zonaite. Ascender permite al jugador moverse hacia arriba a través de superficies **** retroceso se puede utilizar en un objeto para "rebobinar" su movimiento.Regresan los Santuarios y las semillas korok.Cuando se completan los Santuarios otorgan a los jugadores una Luz de Bendición; cuando se obtienen cuatro,Link puede usarlos para aumentar la cantidad de corazones que tiene en uno o expandir el tamaño de su rueda de **** semillas korok se puede usar para aumentar la capacidad de inventario de Link,lo que le permite tener más armas cuerpo a cuerpo, escudos o **** Profundidades a las que se accede a través de abismos en la superficie, albergan una nueva amenaza una sustancia pegajosa llamada Gloom.Cuando Link entra en contacto o es atacado por enemigos cubiertos de Gloom, su número máximo de corazones se reduce temporalmente.Esta aflicción se elimina solo cuando Link regresa a la superficie o encuentra una Raíz que Disipa Las Tinieblas en castellano,una gran planta emisora ​​​​de luz que se encuentra en las profundidades para recuperar su salud máxima.Ahora hay muchísimas más cosas para hacer, más sitios que investigar, más aventuras que vivir y, sobre todo,la calidad de todas y cada una de las actividades con las que daremos se ha incrementado exponencialmente, consiguiendo que algo tan simple como adentrarnos en una cueva resulte en algo apasionante, muy divertido y siempre diferente.Explorar el subsuelo es una experiencia muy diferente y mucho más **** música en las mazmorras gana intensidad a medida que activamos los dispositivos para abrir la puerta del **** el juego también nos deleita con unas misiones secundarias en las que hay espacio para todo, pero que de un modo u otro se las acaban apañando para captar nuestra curiosidad y resultar interesantes con sus pequeñas historias cotidianas y sus intrigantes misterios.Como decimos, las hay de todo tipo y tan pronto nos pedirán que entreguemos un par de pescados que nos tendrán durante horas siguiendo una elaboradísima trama en la que viviremos mil y una aventuras con sus propios jefes.Ultramano es una nueva habilidad que Link puede usar en The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom para recoger objetos y **** objetos que se pueden mover brillarán al entrar al modo Ultramano.Puede usar el botón A para recoger elementos, el D-Pad para empujar elementos hacia adelante o hacia atrás y el botón R para rotar elementos.También puedes unir diferentes objetos moviéndolos juntos y pulsando el botón **** total, he llegado a contar más de 200 entre aventuras secundarias, pruebas heroicas y misiones secundarias, una cifra que a poco que le añadamos la búsqueda de los más de 150 santuarios, la exploración del subsuelo y el cielo la caza de los kolog,la consecución de todas las armaduras, las expediciones a las cuevas y otras muchas actividades que será mejor que descubráis por vosotros mismos, nos deja un juego abrumador y prácticamente inabarcable. Como podréis suponer, muchas misiones no os marcarán nada en el mapa y para resolverlas tendréis que atender a lo que os digan, recabar pistas y usar el **** puzles que te hacen sentir como Indiana Jones buscando ruinas en un desierto, fases de plataformeo que funcionan sorprendentemente bien, o hasta desafíos que parecen sacados de un juego de terror con escenarios tan oscuros que si no llevas una antorcha o usas semillas de luz, te resultará imposible ver siquiera lo que tienes a dos metros de tus ojos. Nintendo se las ingenia una y otra vez para cambiar las reglas de juego obligándote a sacar provecho de todas las nuevas habilidades de Link; y cuando llegas al santuario, te explota la cabeza con las pruebas que ahí te esperan. Olvida eso de encontrar mil y una variaciones de un mismo desafío.GOTB= GAME OF THE BILLON.BILLON= 1 000 000 000 000 años.Ningún juego podrá superar o ser mejor que THE LEGEND OF ZELDA TEARS OF THE KINGDOM

reviewedProduct.title: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

family.name: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

title.name: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

game.name: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

items.quote:
My favorite game of all time. I will admit the new version of the champions aren't my favorite but you can turn them off. The story is amazing and the new mechanism allow for a more puzzle involved play through. The region quests are a bit retentive but I think that's because I did them all at once. The open world is great and the new formula for monster camps is really nice. The new parts of the maps really set in good moods, and the new enemies are great, especially the hands. I was really invested with Zelda's story and loved to chase the new memory collections. The graphics are great and I love how they still sticked to the cartoony style, but just polished it instead. And the sound track is beautiful, the main theme is my number one on my playlist and just running around in all parts of the map, the music caters perfectly. They still keep lots of things from breath of the wild which makes it feel like a visit back to a familiar place.
The game itself runs great, with myself finding no glitches while playing nor bugs. This is really impressive as I share a switch with 3 of my siblings and the fact that the switch is a tiny hand held console.
As the story progresses more things from botw and totk just make more sense, giving the feeling of great discovery.
But apart from the everything, the pure joy I got when I saw the game arrive was like nothing I have ever felt before. Doing the Tutorial Island reminded me of my first time playing Botw on the Wii U and  it just felt so comforting. The feelings the game gives you set a new open world standard that will ever be hard to beat. I hope this version of the games keeps continuing because it's been the happiest while of my life while playing this Masterpiece.

reviewedProduct.title: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

family.name: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

items.quote:
Let’s list what I liked about Breath if the wild first:
1. I really enjoyed the unique story, it felt like it all fell into place and it having great effect on the world.
2. The realistic nature.
3. The few “big” side quests were amazing and felt like it had impact (often small) on the world.
4. The living breathing realistic world.

Now let’s see what I didn’t like about Tears of the kingdom:
1. The story felt like it tried to imitate that of Breath of the wild. And it failed miserably with the memory system feeling forced and it just isn’t interesting in general.
2. The nature is now littered with ugly dark grey rocks in unnatural square shapes and ugly bright green pictures on the land which make no sense story wise when you think about it even a little bit.
3. All side quests were meaningless with no impact on the world at all.
4. The world feels very artificial, with people not talking about the freaking apocalypse that was the upheaval but instead they worry more about things like fashion and traveling across the world… to a scorching hot desert with a constant sandstorm. Nah, they don’t care. Almost as if it doesn’t exist and doesn’t mater. 5. All the regional phenomena stories **** except for maybe the Zora one, that just feels tedious at times.

items.quote:
It's frustrating as hell, BotW was a struggle as well but I pushed through it because everyone liked it. Won't do the same with TotK, played it for like 11 hours and I'm done, this is not for me.

They took BotW and cranked up the **** tenfold with the Zonai devices and mandatory weapon fusing. I played it on a Switch emulator with unlimited weapon durability (with 60fps on 2K) so I can't even imagine the tedium normal players have to endure.

My main issue with the latest Zelda games is a lack of direction (even though I absolutely love Elden Ring where I was constantly lost). Yes, the game throws some objective markers at you but it's still overwhelming. That combined with it's lack-luster combat, unrewarding gameplay loop, boatload of puzzles and ungodly amount of walking make this a dreadful experience, the cumbersome mechanics of the Ultra-Hand and Zonai devices just added to my frustration.

It is what it is, I don't like Baldur's Gate 3 either, it's too slow. My ADHD brain needs quick and constant stimulation otherwise I'm out, no matter how highly praised it is by critics and the general populace.
Give me a weapon, some enemies to kill (with a good combat system) and I'm good. Leave the "wandering around aimlessly" and "finding what to do next" parts to real-life, or at least make it worth my while. None of the places look interesting or memorable.

In conclusion, for me this game is boring, frustrating and tedious.

If you relate to how I feel:

Don't let the internet make you play a game you don't like, just accept that you're different and move on.
There is something for everyone.

items.quote:
Tears of the Kingdom is a fantastic game that builds on the foundations of Breath of the Wild in a number of ways. The new abilities are a lot of fun to use, and they allow for a lot of creativity in how you approach puzzles and combat. The story is also well-written and engaging, and the boss fights are some of the best in the series.
However, there are some areas where Tears of the Kingdom could be improved. The grinding can be a bit repetitive at times, and the game can be a bit too easy for experienced players. Overall, though, Tears of the Kingdom is a great game that is sure to please fans of the Zelda franchise.
The new abilities are a lot of fun to use. The Ultrahand is especially versatile, and it can be used to solve puzzles, build structures, and even fight enemies.
The story is well-written and engaging. The characters are likable and relatable, and the plot is full of twists and turns.
The boss fights are some of the best in the series. They are challenging but fair, and they require you to use all of your skills to defeat them.
The grinding can be a bit repetitive. There are a few areas in the game where you need to grind for materials, and this can get tedious after a while.
Overall, I really enjoyed Tears of the Kingdom. It is a great game that is sure to please fans of the Zelda franchise. If you are looking for a fun and challenging game with a great story, then I highly recommend Tears of the Kingdom.

reviewedProduct.title: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

family.name: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

title.name: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

game.name: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

items.quote:
Grosse attente, énorme déception.
J'ai adoré Botw, j'y ai passé des centaines d'heures, j'ai polishé ce jeu dans le moindre recoin, c'est pour dire que j'attendais ce nouvel opus avec beaucoup d'impatience.
Dans l'ensemble Totk n'est pas un mauvais jeu, loin de là, mais Nintendo à reproduit les mêmes erreurs que dans Botw et en a commis de nouvelles.

Points positifs :
- Les îles dans le ciel sont vraiment sympa, c'est l'ajout le plus intéressant dans cet opus.
- Le nouveau pouvoir d'amalgame pour les armes et les objets est top également, fini d'accumuler des milliers de ressources qui ne servent plus à rien.
- Les grottes sont sympa
- Les combat de fin sont plus intéressants
- Les nouveaux costumes pour voler et grimper les murs humides
- Les cornes des ennemis utilisables sur les armes
- Les temples sont bien, mais trop faciles encore une fois
- Le système de batteries pour les artefacts Soneau est intéressant

Points négatifs :
- Le jeu est bien trop facile dans l'ensemble, pas de sélection de niveau de difficulté
- Une alternative aux gardiens archéoniques manque cruellement, on se promène dans un monde sans aucun dangers au coin de la rue.
- Les "puzzles" sont d'une nullité affligeante, la solution est à 2 mètres....
- Aucun challenge pour récupérer des morceaux de dragons
- Le sous-sol beaucoup trop grand, vite marre de tout explorer pour trouver des coffres inutiles
- Le sous-sol bien bien moche
- Les récompenses bien pourries quand on collecte tous les korogus, active toutes les racines, etc...
- Les sanctuaires sont nul dans l'ensemble, bien trop faciles, aucun challenge, et la moitié sont des bénédiction de Rauru.
- Les coffres dans les sanctuaires nous donnent des trucs inutiles, des armes trop faibles, etc...
- Les Yiga sont vraiment nuls, aucun intérêt.
- Les tours sont bien trop faciles
- Les armes qui se cassent toujours bien trop vite (toujours pas de forgeron, mais des combines abracadabrantes pour essayer de réparer les armes).
- Aucune explications de ce qui c'est passé entre les deux opus
- Les quêtes annexes sont pour la plupart totalement inintéressantes et trop faciles
- On peu toujours pas aller sous l'eau
- Défilement des objets fastidieux, bien chiant pour chaque flèche ou amalgame d'armes
- Bien trop de tenues inutiles
- Les doublages français sont assez médiocres (bon, au moins il y en a, pas comme sur les grosses productions PC), des erreurs de prononciation (sonAeau au lieu de soneau), voix pas adaptées aux personnages, etc... quelle idée de renommer Zonai en Soneau déjà....
- Les chevaux sont toujours inutiles (incontrôlables), et on peu même pas les manger (tout comme les chiens et autres animaux invulnérables sans aucune raison).
- Un peu trop de copier/coller du 1er, on sent bien la grosse flemme des développeurs.
- Trop cher pour ce que c'est
- 30fps en 720p en 2023, difficilement acceptable quand d'autres consoles sont à 120/144fps en 4K HDR.

Et surtout, la fin est toujours aussi nulle que dans Botw, une fois Ganondorf vaincu on revient en arrière dans le jeu, cela ne fait aucun sens, c'est la même erreur que dans Botw, il aurait mieux fallu proposer de revenir en arrière pour terminer les quêtes qui doivent se faire avant, ou choisir de continuer le jeu en débarrassant toute la carte des monstres, plus de lune de sang, de nouvelles quêtes pour remettre le royaume en ordre, etc... Un tel DLC entre les deux opus aurait également pu faire le lien entre les deux. C'est vraiment une occasion manquée, ça gâche vraiment le jeu de ne pas avoir une vraie fin.
Il ont eu plus de six ans pour développer ce jeu (avec pompage de 80% de Botw), on aurait du avoir un meilleur résultat.
Il se sont aussi planté niveau date de sortie, ils auraient du sortir la nouvelle Switch en même temps (on était pas à un an près), ou au moins ajouter le jeu dans la version de la Switch version Totk.

J'ai terminé le jeu en une quarantaine d'heures, et je n'ai plus aucune envie d'y jouer ni de terminer toutes les quêtes que je n'ai pas faites tellement ce jeu est ennuyeux.

items.quote:
IF YOU'RE SUPER INTO GRAPHICS THEN THIS GAME ISN'T FOR YOU! The art style does a lot of heavy lifting, but in the end, it's 720p at 30 fps. And it gets more noticeable when you play another game immediately after TOTK. I see trees loading and unloading into 2D sprites a lot, water not rendering properly from afar, and a lot of other stuff. In the end though, I don't think that it's the devs fault for releasing a good game on a horrible console.

If any BOTW player is wondering if theres any huge progression change in TOTK, the core of it is basically the same as BOTW. Theres a lot of gameplay elements that were changed, and the quests, dungeons and shrine puzzles are a lot cooler now, but it does end up feeling like deja vu sometimes. Even though I thought this game was definitely worth my money after playing BOTW, it's pretty reasonable if you think otherwise.

items.quote:
Tears of the kingdom is the worst game of 2023!

>despite being a set protag the game asks for your pronouns

>The legend of Zelda theme by system of a down makes an appearance

>In the English dub the merchants will speak a lot and some of them are noticeably male despite some of them voicing females

>Mario movie references

>shrines are back and are still tiny two-room physics puzzles that give you a spirit orb
I honestly lost interest after ragu told me to do two more shrines.

>korok seeds are back

>weapon durability works the same way

>The gerudo dancer outfit now says "meme worthy costume" in it's description

>The construction feature of the game will autodetect if you are making a swastika

>Fusing is really limited

>The time travel thing can only happen in one location

>master sword has energy durability still

>map is 90% the same

>The other 10% has reused assets to do something "new"

>There's now a town full of black people

>flurry rush is back and still has the same massive timing window

>no playable Zelda

>There's references to shriek and how "he" transcends the idea of gender

They don't outright call her a tranzy but the intention is pretty visible

>There are only 4 dungeons (+ hyrule castle, SAME hyrule castle map)

>Its the same area you can see in the trailer with Sidon!

>There's a souvenir that depicts an earth globe but it's called "the universal fun balloon" which is a reference to the company making the Nintendo theme park at Orlando.

>Zelda turns into a dragon after link has been killed off screen so she has to step in and access the secret power she had all along and save the day because the hero has nothing on a princess of wisdom (this is a exact line from the dub)

Overall an unmitigated disaster.
Theres just games that are so much better and deserve more and sales, do yourself a favor, don't buy this game.

items.quote: Deja a BOTW como una demo, el juego incluye cosas nuevas, una historia muchísimo más interesante que la de su secuela, pero tampoco es algo que sorprenda. Lo que más me ha gustado es la libertad que tienes y las cinemáticas, pero no ofrece nada nuevo como videojuego, todo lo que está en el juego lo hemos visto en otros juegos implementado de distinta forma, ya sea parecida o no, por lo que no es nada novedoso. El mundo es más extenso ya que añade las islas del cielo (escasas a mi parecer), y el subsuelo, que es Hyrule pero invertido. Los enemigos nuevos son muy chulos, pero son enemigos vistos en otros juegos de Zelda. Eso de fusionar lo que pilles con armas o escudos me gustó bastante, pero como he dicho, es lo típico de recolectar materiales y fabricarte armas. No es un juego para todo el mundo, si no te gusta estar farmeando materiales, esperar a los dragones para conseguir sus materiales, que la historia principal dure poco pero tengas una cantidad de secundarias que amplían la experiencia como 50 horas, pues no es para tí, y no es el mejor mundo abierto, pero sigue siendo el mejor juego para Nintendo Switch. Es un juego que está ahí, si tienes switch es imprescindible, es bastante entretenido, pero no es lo mejor del año ni de lejos, ya que ofrece lo mismo que casi todos los mundos abiertos que estén bien hechos, infinidad de horas para explorar, ir a donde quieras, farmeo intenso y luego ya si quieres seguir con la historia, la sigues, porque no estás obligado a pasártela para hacer lo que te plazca, algo que siempre gusta porque no te limita

items.quote:
It’s easy to say that Tears of the Kingdom grabs the same formula from Breath of the Wild and in many cases, it does. But, it takes that formula and improves upon in every single way possible. Bigger world, more options with combat, new toys to play with, new abilities to use and abuse. The world is your playground in Tears of the Kingdom and it’s one of the only idea games that every grabbed that idea and went to town on its ambitions.

Tears of the Kingdom sets a new benchmark in open world games, even more so than its predecessor. Tears also improves upon its story telling in which it tells one of the best Zelda stories to date, and may even rival Ocarina of Time’s wonderful storyline. While the game does look a bit dated, the gameplay and exploration potential more than makes up for it. Giving you verticality in sky or underground, all the adding new abilities like Fuse (which never gets old) and ascend to transverse in all new ways.

This entry breaks new ground into the Zelda series and into gaming as a whole. It’s the new standard for open world games and any game I play in the future with this concept will be scrutinized with Tears of the Kingdom in mind. It’s a masterpiece through and through. Play this game.

items.quote:
This is the best game I have ever played, for me it surpasses breath of the wild. The story in tears is much better and more interesting, the dungeons are very fun and the depths are awesome, it's the only game fun enough for me to want to 100% it. The ganondorf fight was really fun and every boss was cool, the ending when you catch Zelda got me so emotional.
The only downside is the sky islands, there are very little of them wich is a bit sad, but the depths make up for it. This is a must play for any gamer in the world. The graphics are on the top, it doesn't need 120fps and 4k, the building is fun and the depths and sky are beautiful, you could be exploring this world for hours even if you already done it in botw, there are so many new things to do in this familiar yet new hyrule.

reviewedProduct.title: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

family.name: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

title.name: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

game.name: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

items.quote:
DISAPPOINTING AND OVERRATED.

I was never excited for this game. Every time Nintendo showed off a new trailer, I yawned. Only reason I got this was because my nephew wanted it.

Admittedly, I was HOOKED at first. Exploring to find whatever new equipment you can get your hands on was addicting. Then it got old. You're pretty much exploring the same landscape from Breath of the Wild so there's no REAL big surprises. Your weapons breaking makes a return and it becomes pointless fighting enemies if your weapons are just gonna break again. I end up not wanting to use my best weapons because I don't want them to break.

People say it's great to have so much to do, but there's nothing FUN to do! Exploring the depths is just time consuming because you're just uncovering the map and grinding for materials to upgrade your batteries or collecting enough poes to get that Dark Link armor you probably want.

The sky islands are just..... there.

The side quests are mostly just pointless. Most of the time I run into a NPC asking me to clear out an area or gather some stuff. Side Quest initiated. Side Quested completed. No sense of accomplishment. That's what this game is. I never feel like I'm really accomplishing anything. Nothing to look forward to.

In all honesty, I've only beaten ONE dungeon. But I know I've seen everything there is this game has to offer me. I'm actually shocked at this personal realization to what I'm about to say. I've loved the Zelda series, it means so much to me, didn't like Skyward Sword, but honestly, I don't think I can ever continue this journey to defeat Ganon in Tears of the Kingdom. I have no motivation to do it.

While I hated Skyward Sword, I at least finished it. Tears of the Kingdom....... I'll never finish it. I'm angry that I was right. I'm even more angrier that I spent the $70 Nintendo thought this carbon copy was worth.

A software engineer, a hardware engineer, and their manager are driving to a meeting when the car they are in gets a flat tire.

The software engineer says, "Let's run diagnostics to see if we can identify the issue."

The hardware engineer suggests, "Let's swap out the tire and see if that fixes the problem."

The manager chimes in, "How about we get out of the car, and then get back in. Maybe it will start working again!"

items.quote: I would have been significantly happier if this game was just a dlc to BOTW.  But alas, it was it's successor and thus a disappointment.  Nothing new.  Abilities are inferior versions of the abilities in BOTW.  Dungeons are disjointed and laughably easy.  At least the ones in BOTW had a gimmick. Story is not cohesive.  Fake Zelda went on for too long.  I get that you can do the dungeons in any order, but COME ON.  Link knows that Zelda is fake like after the first dungeon.  WHY DOESN'T HE SAY ANYTHING.

items.quote:
Is always incredible how Nintendo reinvents itself. Breath of the Wild was big enough to satisfy a whole generation and then they give us this sequel with more bigger, deeper and better. Rediscovering the same Hyrule and how it changed over the years is a whole new adventure that it taste better when you remember the last open world, now way more expanded to include 3 maps: the one for the surface, and other 2 for the sky and the underground.

New abilities of Link are the core now, and truly you can almost build everything with that if you find how and are creative enough: now you can travel and resolve puzzles with a lot of more freedom and the world is designed for this to work perfectly. The story follows the previous one, but I have the feeling as if were more years passed instead of a few ones, like hundred instead of a bunch, anyway, this is explained better once you play it and it make sense, but the story is now a bit more serious, prove of this is hat now we must face our archenemy Ganondorf to save the world.

Those negative ratings are from review bombing losers and must be erased, but even with that the game have a great score here and just like in Zelda series, the truth and light will always prevail and erase the darkness and evil. Play this masterpiece and enjoy.

items.quote: I've played Ocarina of Time, Majora's Mask, Twilight Princess, Skyward Sword, Breath of the Wild and The Wind Waker. I didn't like Wind Waker, but Tears of the Kingdom made me like Wind Waker. This game is just... off. The fuse mechanic is ridiculous in some cases. Fuse a stick with a boulder? Just silly. What the Zelda team was thinking? Instead of doing dungeons, they made those large shrines with "dungeons" in the name. I absolute hated the shrines in Breath of the Wild, hence I hate the shrines in Tears of the Kingdom. They are all the same puzzles that you can figure it out in minutes. The shrines are all the same. The underground segments are extremely boring, the sky island are all the same. The list to choose the material to fuse during battle freeze the screen and take it out the immersion of the game just rolling till you find the material you are looking for, just terrible. And the frames... Oh my, the frame rate of this game is AWFUL. The story is not so good, all the flashbacks of the past again and you need to find the boring geoglyphs' puddles. Where's the magic? The items, the dungeons, the good story? I cannot take Ganondorf anymore. Unfortunately this game sold a lot, and Nintendo will acknowledge this game as a base for future Zeldas. This game is no Zelda, this game is Banjo-Kazooie Nuts and Bolts with the word ZELDA on the cover. I'm so frustrated that one of my favourite franchises was reduced to this.

items.quote: It is an extraordinary work, pure art and one of the best Zelda games ever made. It has a captivating story, with moments both emotional and epic. With a very well-developed gameplay thanks to Link's new powers, the use of his weapons combined with the materials we find and the possibility of building useful objects for the adventure make the experience very fun, in addition, the new exploration of Hyrule from the skies or the underground is something new and gives a fresh air to the map design, with excellent secondary missions and various challenges such as puzzles and demanding monsters (which force us to use strategy as the main weapon) makes everything shine despite the Shadows of the Cataclysm. The Dungeons levels design also are marvelous. Being a direct sequel to Breath of the Wild, it kept most of its creatures: monsters and animals, as well as repeating some of its melodies during exploration (on horseback is where it becomes most noticeable), however the newly incorporated songs of its masterful soundtrack and well-crafted level boss fights make it a total triumph. This game is, without a doubt, a step forward in the Zelda’s future. Once again, Zelda is legend.

items.quote: I've sunken a quite a bit of time in BOTW and loved just about every aspect of the game itself, so you already know that I've been hyped for this game ever since it was announced. I just gotta say I was not disappointed, better yet, it surpassed my expectations as a long time Zelda fan. Despite the fact that it did make some quality of life improvements, it's a whole new game on its own. I can kind of see why people are calling it the same, but in order to progress a story like BOTW, it kind of had to take place in hyrule again. Not to mention, I loved going back to the old places that have changed and comparing the two. Overall, incredible game, would recommend to all different types of players. Nintendo really is putting in the work and we all love it.

items.quote:
The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom es una secuela más esperada del año de 2023 y teniendo en cuenta de que es la secuela de Zelda: Beth of the Wild no es para menos, es una secuela que ceje nuestras expectativas y se ríe de ellas, es una salvajada que no solo pueda tener un juego así de bestial una consola tan limitada como una Nintendo switch sino que es la respuesta a la pregunta de: ¿Si Zelda Breth of the Wild es de una consola prácticamente obsoleta cuando salió compitiendo con la PS4 y Xbox One, que hará Nintendo teniendo una consola mucho mas potente cómodo la switch? Pues este juego es la respuesta, los 6 años de desarrollo de Zelda TOTK para mi opinión an merecido completamente la pena, además de que dice mucho de Nintendo el que se cogieran todo un año para pulir el juego, sobresale mas con juegos como Redfall, Forspoken, juegos que salieron rotos de lanzamiento.

La única pega que se le puede ver a este juego es un poco la historia, para mi opinión abría estado mejor que el prologo fuera mas largo, no un prologo sino que un primer cuarto del juego fuera para el prologo, esto para poder estar mas cerca de Zelda y Por una vez que no la tenemos que rescatar y podemos estar mas tiempo con ella para que cuando llegara la hora de perderla fuera todavía mas impactante, y en final (SIN EXPOILERS) que las dos perdidas de los dos héroes fueran permanentes, para que sintiéramos de que esto ha costado, a dolido pero que lo hemos conseguido, emos acabado con el mal, aunque luego te devolviera al punto de control antes de la batalla como si nada hubiera pasado. Pero quitando esto yo no habría cambiado nada más excepto la cutrada de la cinemática de la guerra del destierro que nos cuentan cinco veces con la misma cinemática. El resto de la historia y como esta contada de parece perfecto.

Pero estos son los únicos fallos que veo que se le pueden sacar al juego el resto me parece perfecto y todos los huevos que le faltan a la historia los tiene el gamplay que es no solo el mejor de la saga sino de muchos videojuegos, cada uno de los cuatro poderes podría haber sido la mecánica principal de un juego cada uno pero no, están todas en el mismo videojuego.
La ultra mano que es una versión del imán elevada a la cuarta; Retroceso que es una vuelta de tuerca a estasis; La Infiltración que demuestra la increíble agilidad de los diseñadores rediseñando el mapa y haciendo las islas teniendo en cuenta esta mecánica; Y por ultimo la agilidad de fusionar es la versión de la ultra mano para armas, pero que además soluciona el problema que tenían la gente con la durabilidad de las armas, todos los nuevos poderes son grandiosos.

Además de que Nintendo dice que Teras of the Kimdom repite mapa de Breth of the Wild pero esto es mentira, muy mentira, repite la base de la superficie de Hyrule pero la mayor parte del mapa de BOTW lo han cambiado para que la gente como yo que se sabe el mapa como la palma de mi "ultra mano" (eso era un chiste) tenga una experiencia como la que tubo en 2017 cuando salió el original no cambiando el tronco pero si un montón de matices haciéndote dudar y preguntándote: ¿Esto estaba aquí?, ¿Esto lo han cambiado?. Lo mejor de todo esquí este juego tiene otros dos mapas mas: En primer lugar tenemos la superficie, luego tenemos las islas flotantes que la verdad no abarcan tanto terreno y arrea pero la que abarcan la hacen a la perfección, dando rienda suelta a la ultra mano con materiales y puzles para ella y luego la mayor sorpresa del juego, el subsuelo este no se anuncia en ninguna parte, Nintendo si que hablo de las islas celestes pero lo peor es que no hablamos de cuatro cuevas que también las tiene el juego el juego y están muy bien echas, sino de un mega cueva tan densa como la superficie comunicada por los abismos mega agujeros que se conectan con la superficie estos con vegetación, animales y enemigos completamente nuevos, porno mencionar que estos enemigos quitan vida máxima solo la puedes restablecer subiendo a la superficie o hiendo a unas raíces que las hay a millares pero lo suficiente mente lejos para que no se sientan diferentes.

En definitiva si quieres un juego de aventura o mundo abierto este no es que sea una buena recomendación sino un imprescindible de la switch un clásico junto a su precuela BOTW al niel que lo fueron Zelda Ocarina of Time y Mayora´s Mask. Los únicos fallos que le encuentro al juego se encuentran en la historia pero con sus peros una muy buena y puede que para muchos emotiva, pero el gameplay no excepcional sino majestuoso como la musica tan grandiosa como la de su precuela pero más épica, majestuosa y grandiosa. Pero lo que mas a cambiado es el verbo del juego , si el verbo de BOTW era explora, el de TOTK es imagina, crea y luego explora por eso se le pueden perdonar los fallos en la historia y por eso no es solo el mejor juego del año sino de la generación.
9.8

items.quote: As a huge The Legend of Zelda fan, cant express how disappointed I was from this game. The videos Nintendo showed as huge differences and improvements from the previous BOW title were pretty much everything that changed. In my view they have to come back to the formula as it was wind waker, twilight princess, ocarina of time, etc. BOW and TOK exhausted everything o the new mechanics. Theyre not interesting or replayable anymore. The story was not that good, Ganondorf was a complete waste, and has only the memories story and patiently dont do anything in the whole game but wait for Link to come kill him. Thes sky islands are just hard to reach (without cheating with infinite batteries) but plain except forthe ones on the main story, enemies are as repetitive as BOW an the worst thing ever the weapons still break even faster than before, who thought of that? The undergropunds is mere distraction, there is nothing there worth to go. The map is the same and disappointing to see after 6 years of 'work' and the temples were a huge disappointment, really the divine beasts without the controls. But equally boring and one more than before. The final boss disappointing, only flurry rush. Cant say anything that was positive and after finishing the game I didnt chnage my mind. Maybe a 5 if lucky, but sad to experience a DCL that pretended to be very different.

items.quote:
While the graphics partially improved (when the resolution is not tanked and you just see a blurry mess due to switch limitations), how the world and puzzles has been designed lead to a world that is always a different alternative to a cohesive one, so you will rarely be able to explore in a pragmatic way.
You ends up bouncing around 3 or more different levels, and to be honest the lowest one is just ugly - yea the phasma comes from underground but when you play it seems they just added it because Elden Ring got one, no other reason up to the end.
What happens is that the world is so uninteresting and the exploration so interrupted that I would continue playing again the first game for the 2nd time - as I was doing - then going on with this.
Everything is an alternative of what was great, powers included. The only exception is "ascension", but I really would like bombs, glacius and the other set.
The attempt of copyrighting physics and basic actions should deserve a 0 but it would not respect the game quality.
Not Diablo 4 delusion level, but to me it is still a delusion
